name.en: Applied Well Logging and Petroleum Systems

goal.ch:
應用井測學說明井測學概念、施測及其在地下資源探勘之重要性和應用。介紹基本井測(自然電位差，電阻，伽瑪射線，孔隙率，地層傾斜，核磁共振，介電質)之原理。應用井測資料計算、解釋及估算儲層岩石物理性質。一個石油系統包括活動的生油岩和油氣積聚相關的所有基本要素和過程，該基本要素是生油岩，儲層岩，密封岩和上覆岩，過程包括封阻形成和石油的生成移棲積聚。所有的基本要素放在時間和空間上，形成一個可能會產生石油儲集的必要過程，它結合生油岩和主要儲集岩也表現出一定程度的確定性，已知假設或推理。四張圖幅和一個表描繪石油系統的地理，地層，時間演變及建立埋藏史年代和關鍵時刻，在關鍵時刻繪製的地圖和橫截面，形成一個總結石油系統的事件圖表和相關的累積表。在油氣探勘作業上，整合地質、地物及地化資料，進行石油系統的成因分析以評估其油氣潛能。
 近年來由於對油氣的迫切需求造成探勘技術長足而廣泛的進步：生物氣生成與氣藏形成機理發現了世界級生物大氣田。非傳統油氣探勘把富有機質的黑色頁岩當成生油岩、蓋層，近年來鑽井資料中發現儲量豐富，但儲集層緻密只有在大量裂縫的情形下形成大量油氣聚集，開採技術如何克服使成為世界級的產量？利用震測及聲波測錄分析生油岩和油氣儲層的岩石物理特性。
goal.en:
Applied well logging: Understanding well logging basic concept, operation and application to resources underground exploration. Introduce fundamental logs(SP, Resistivity, Gamma Ray, Porosity Logs, Dip-meter, NMR, Dielectric). Apply well logs for calculation and interpretation and estimate physical properties of reservoir rock. A petroleum system encompasses a pod of active source rock and all related oil and gas and essential elements and processes needed for oil and gas accumulations to exist. The essential elements are the source rock, reservoir rock, seal rock, and overburden rock, and the processes include trap formation and the generation-migration-accumulation of petroleum. All essential elements must be placed in time and space such that the processes required to form a petroleum accumulation can occur. The petroleum system combines the names of the source rock , the major reservoir rock and also expresses a level of certainty—known, hypothetical, or speculative. Four figures and a table that best depict the geographic, stratigraphic, and temporal evolution of a petroleum system include a burial history chart to establish the age and critical moment of the system, a map and a cross section drawn at the critical moment, an events chart to summarize the formation of the petroleum system, and a table of related accumulations. In oil and gas exploration, we can integrate geology, geophysics and geochemistry information to analyze the causes of petroleum systems and evaluate its potential.  
In recent years, the urgent demand for oil and gas has led to great and extensive progress in exploration technology: the mechanism of biogas generation and gas reservoir formation has led to the discovery of the world‘s largest biogas fields. Unconventional oil and gas exploration regards organic-rich black shale as source rock and cap rock. In these years, drilling data have found abundant reserves, but the tight reservoirs can only form a large amount of oil and gas accumulation in the case of large number of fractures. How to overcome the problem of mining technology? Become a world-class producer? Use seismic and sonic recordings to analyze the petrophysical properties of oil source rocks and oil and gas reservoirs.

outline.ch:
應用井測學說明井測學概念、施測及其在地下資源探勘之重要性和應用。介紹基本井測(自然電位差，電阻，伽瑪射線，孔隙率，地層傾斜，核磁共振，介電質)之原理。應用井測資料計算、解釋及估算儲層岩石物理性質。一個石油系統包括活動的生油岩和油氣積聚相關的所有基本要素和過程，該基本要素是生油岩，儲層岩，密封岩和上覆岩，過程包括封阻形成和石油的生成移棲積聚。所有的基本要素放在時間和空間上，形成一個可能會產生石油儲集的必要過程，它結合生油岩和主要儲集岩也表現出一定程度的確定性，已知假設或推理。四張圖幅和一個表描繪石油系統的地理，地層，時間演變及建立埋藏史年代和關鍵時刻，在關鍵時刻繪製的地圖和橫截面，形成一個總結石油系統的事件圖表和相關的累積表。在油氣探勘作業上，整合地質、地物及地化資料，進行石油系統的成因分析以評估其油氣潛能。
近年來由於對油氣的迫切需求造成探勘技術長足而廣泛的進步：生物氣生成與氣藏形成機理發現了世界級生物大氣田。授課內容為：生物氣的生成與聚集（林麗華；2020，台灣中油未刊搞）。非傳統油氣探勘把富有機質的黑色頁岩當成生油岩、蓋層，近年來鑽井資料中發現儲量豐富，但儲集層緻密只有在大量裂縫的情形下形成大量油氣聚集，開採技術如何克服使成為世界級的產量？（呂明達，蕭慕俊；2020，試述美國主要頁岩油氣區塊的現況，中國鑛冶工程學會）。利用震測及聲波測錄分析生油岩和油氣儲層的岩石物理特性（呂明達；2020，生油岩和油氣儲層的岩石物理特性，台灣中油未刊搞）。
outline.en:
Applied well logging: Understanding well logging basic concept, operation and application to resources underground exploration. Introduce fundamental logs(SP, Resistivity, Gamma Ray, Porosity Logs, Dip-meter, NMR, Dielectric). Apply well logs for calculation and interpretation and estimate physical properties of reservoir rock.A petroleum system encompasses a pod of active source rock and all related oil and gas and essential elements and processes needed for oil and gas accumulations to exist. The essential elements are the source rock, reservoir rock, seal rock, and overburden rock, and the processes include trap formation and the generation-migration-accumulation of petroleum. All essential elements must be placed in time and space such that the processes required to form a petroleum accumulation can occur. The petroleum system combines the names of the source rock , the major reservoir rock and also expresses a level of certainty—known, hypothetical, or speculative. Four figures and a table that best depict the geographic, stratigraphic, and temporal evolution of a petroleum system include a burial history chart to establish the age and critical moment of the system, a map and a cross section drawn at the critical moment, an events chart to summarize the formation of the petroleum system, and a table of related accumulations. In oil and gas exploration, we can integrate geology, geophysics and geochemistry information to analyze the causes of petroleum systems and evaluate its potential.
In recent years, due to the urgent demand for oil and gas, the exploration technology has made considerable and extensive progress: biogas generation and gas reservoir formation mechanism have discovered world-class biogas fields. The content of the lecture is: the generation and accumulation of biogas (Lin Lihua; 2020, unpublished by Taiwan Petroleum). Unconventional oil and gas exploration regards organic-rich black shale as source rock and cap rock. In these years, drilling data have found abundant reserves, but the tight reservoirs can only form a large amount of oil and gas accumulation in the case of large number of fractures. How to overcome the problem of mining technology to become a world-class producer? (Lu Mingda, Xiao Mujun; 2020, Briefly describe the current situation of major shale oil and gas blocks in the United States, China Society of Mining and Metallurgy Engineering.) Use seismic and sonic recordings to analyze the petrophysical properties of oil and gas source rocks and reservoirs (Lu Mingtar; 2020, Petrophysical Properties of Oil and Gas Source Rock and Reservoirs, unpublished by Taiwan Petroleum Corporation).

textbook.ch: “George Asquish and Daniel Krygowski, 2004, Basic Well Log Analysis(Second Edition) , The American Association of Peroleum GeologistsTulsa, OK Magoon, L. B. and Dow, W. G., 1994, The Petroleum System: From Source to Trap, The American Association of Peroleum Geologists Tulsa, OK“
textbook.en: “George Asquish and Daniel Krygowski, 2004, Basic Well Log Analysis(Second Edition) , The American Association of Peroleum GeologistsTulsa, OK Magoon, L. B. and Dow, W. G., 1994, The Petroleum System: From Source to Trap, The American Association of Peroleum Geologists Tulsa, OK“
